channel.title: [317]Help?
channel.description:
I need more help with a few things..
I have a Pest Control Mini-Game on my 317, for the rewards, I tested them all out (they are all 100 points each) but they don't take 100 points. How do I modify how much it takes for the rewards?
Another thing, how do I add items to my Assault Mini-Game shop? I've looked it up in Client.Java, but can't find anything about it. I can actually add the items, but I don't know how to make it take Assault Points instead of money.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: [317]Help?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

I take no credit for this so don’t say its fucking leeched: ( -.- )

Difficulty: 2/10
Edited files:Client.Java, Shop.Cfg
Credits: I did do this on my own, but i honestly don’t care if it gets leeched. Also, i don’t need the drama of “lyke LEECHED FRUM Insert Site/Source Here”

Alright so lets get to it.

Step 1: Just in case, make a backup of your Client.java.
Step 2: Open client.java and search for something like this

} else if (interfaceID == 3823) { //Show value to sell items
Look under that for something like this
if (ShopValue <= 1)
{
ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot));
}
if (ShopValue >= 1000 && ShopValue < 1000000) {
ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000) + “K)”;
} else if (ShopValue >= 1000000) {
ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000000) + " million)";
}
Under the last } add This piece of code.
if (MyShopID == %%) {
sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": Shop will buy for “+ ShopValue + " &&&&&&&” + ShopAdd);
} else {
sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": Shop will buy for “+ ShopValue + " coins” + ShopAdd);
}
}
}
The % is going to be the ID of your shop.
The &&&&&&& is the name of the currency. We will be using Tokkul for ours :).

Your code should now look something like this

if (ShopValue <= 1)
{
ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot));
}
if (ShopValue >= 1000 && ShopValue < 1000000) {
ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000) + “K)”;
} else if (ShopValue >= 1000000) {
ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000000) + " million)";
}
if (MyShopID == 1) {
sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": Shop will buy for “+ ShopValue + " Tokkul” + ShopAdd);
} else {
sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": Shop will buy for “+ ShopValue + " coins” + ShopAdd);
}
}
Depending on your server you MAY need to add or take away brackets, please just note this.

Step 3:
Next, search for something like this
} else if (interfaceID == 3900) { //Show value to buy items
under it you should see something similer this:
if (WanneShop > -1) {
int ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot));
String ShopAdd = “”;
if (ShopValue <= 1)
{
ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot));
}
if (ShopValue >= 1000 && ShopValue < 1000000) {
ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000) + “K)”;
} else if (ShopValue >= 1000000) {
ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000000) + " million)";
}
Under the last } add this:
if (MyShopID == 1) {
sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs “+ ShopValue + " tokkul” + ShopAdd);
} else {
sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs “+ ShopValue + " coins” + ShopAdd);
}
}

Same step as above, the (MyShopID == 1) is your shop and the " tokkul" Is what your currency is going to be.
Your code will now look like this.
} else if (interfaceID == 3900) { //Show value to buy items
if (WanneShop > -1) {
int ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot));
String ShopAdd = “”;
if (ShopValue <= 1)
{
ShopValue = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0, removeSlot));
}
if (ShopValue >= 1000 && ShopValue < 1000000) {
ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000) + “K)”;
} else if (ShopValue >= 1000000) {
ShopAdd = " (" + (ShopValue / 1000000) + " million)";
}
if (MyShopID == 9 || MyShopID == 10 || MyShopID == 11) {
sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs “+ ShopValue + " tokkul” + ShopAdd);
} else {
sendMessage(GetItemName(removeID) + ": currently costs “+ ShopValue + " coins” + ShopAdd);
}

Step 4:
Search for public boolean sellItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
Under that you should see:
if (amount > 0 && itemID == (playerItems[fromSlot] - 1)) {
if (server.shopHandler.ShopSModifier[MyShopID] > 1) {
boolean IsIn = false;
for (int i = 0; i <= server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]; i++) {
if (itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][i] - 1)) {
IsIn = true;
break;
}
}
Under the last } add this:
if (MyShopID == 1) {
sendMessage(“You cannot sell " + GetItemName(itemID) + " in this store.”);
return false;
}
if (IsIn == false) {
sendMessage(
"You cannot sell " + GetItemName(itemID)

  • " in this store.");
    return false;
    }
    }
    Your code will look like this:
    public boolean sellItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
    if (amount > 0 && itemID == (playerItems[fromSlot] - 1)) {
    if (server.shopHandler.ShopSModifier[MyShopID] > 1) {
    boolean IsIn = false;
    for (int i = 0; i <= server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]; i++) {
    if (itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][i] - 1)) {
    IsIn = true;
    break;
    }
    }
    if (MyShopID == 1) {
    sendMessage(“You cannot sell " + GetItemName(itemID) + " in this store.”);
    return false;
    }
    if (IsIn == false) {
    sendMessage(
    "You cannot sell " + GetItemName(itemID)
  • " in this store.");
    return false;
    }
    }
    Step 5:
    Next, serach for: addItem(995, TotPrice2);
    The code should look something like this
    for (int i = amount; i > 0; i–) {
    TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 1, fromSlot));
    if (freeSlots() > 0) {
    if (Item.itemIsNote[itemID] == false) {
    deleteItem(itemID, GetItemSlot(itemID), 1);
    } else {
    deleteItem(itemID, fromSlot, 1);
    }
    addItem(995, TotPrice2);
    addShopItem(itemID, 1);
    } else {
    sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
    break;
    }
    }
    Above for (int i = amount; i > 0; i–) {
    Add this
    if (MyShopID != 1) {
    Add another } under the last one. Your code will look like this
    if (MyShopID != 1) {
    for (int i = amount; i > 0; i–) {
    TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 1, fromSlot));
    if (freeSlots() > 0) {
    if (Item.itemIsNote[itemID] == false) {
    deleteItem(itemID, GetItemSlot(itemID), 1);
    } else {
    deleteItem(itemID, fromSlot, 1);
    }
    addItem(995, TotPrice2);
    addShopItem(itemID, 1);
    } else {
    sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
    break;
    }
    }
    }
    Under the } add this
    if (MyShopID == 1) {
    for (int i = amount; i > 0; i–) {
    TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 1, fromSlot));
    if (freeSlots() > 0) {
    if (Item.itemIsNote[itemID] == false) {
    deleteItem(itemID, GetItemSlot(itemID), 1);
    } else {
    deleteItem(itemID, fromSlot, 1);
    }
    addItem(6529, TotPrice2);
    addShopItem(itemID, 1);
    } else {
    sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
    break;
    }
    }
    }
    Quick look at this: The addItem(6529, TotPrice2); is the currency Id, for this example its tokkul. Remeber this can be changed to anything :).

Step 6: Search for
public boolean buyItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
Your code should look something like this:
public boolean buyItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
if (amount > 0 && itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] - 1)) {
if (amount > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot]) {
amount = server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot];
}
double ShopValue;
double TotPrice;
int TotPrice2;
int Overstock;
int Slot = 0;
for (int i = amount; i > 0; i–) {
TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot));
Slot = GetItemSlot(995);
if (Slot == -1) {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough coins.”);
break;
}

Under int Slot = 0;
add this int Slot2 = 0;
Change the if (Slot == -1) {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough coins.”);
break;
}
To this:
if (Slot == -1 && MyShopID != 1) {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough coins.”);
break;
}
and under that add this

else if (Slot2 == -1 && MyShopID == 1) {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough tokkul.”);
break;
}
The code should look like this
public boolean buyItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
if (amount > 0 && itemID == (server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] - 1)) {
if (amount > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot]) {
amount = server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot];
}
double ShopValue;
double TotPrice;
int TotPrice2;
int Overstock;
int Slot = 0;
int Slot2 = 0;
for (int i = amount; i > 0; i–) {
TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot));
Slot = GetItemSlot(995);
Slot2 = GetItemSlot(6529);

if (Slot == -1 && MyShopID != 9 && MyShopID != 10 && MyShopID != 11) {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough coins.”);
break;
}

else if (Slot2 == -1 && MyShopID == 9 && MyShopID == 10 && MyShopID == 11) {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough tokkul.”);
break;
}

Step 7:
Under that, look for this

if(TotPrice2 <= 1)
{
TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot));
}
if (playerItemsN[Slot] >= TotPrice2) {
if (freeSlots() > 0) {
deleteItem(995, GetItemSlot(995), TotPrice2);
addItem(itemID, 1);
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1;
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) {
server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
}
} else {
sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
break;
}
} else {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough coins.”);
break;
}
}
Change all of that to this:
if(TotPrice2 <= 1)
{
TotPrice2 = (int)Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(itemID, 0, fromSlot));
}
if (MyShopID != 1) {
if (playerItemsN[Slot] >= TotPrice2) {
if (freeSlots() > 0) {
deleteItem(995, GetItemSlot(995), TotPrice2);
addItem(itemID, 1);
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1;
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) {
server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
}
} else {
sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
break;
}
} else {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough coins.”);
}
}

Under all of that, add in this:
if (MyShopID == 1) {
if (playerItemsN[Slot2] >= TotPrice2) {
if (freeSlots() > 0) {
deleteItem(6529, GetItemSlot(6529), TotPrice2);
addItem(itemID, 1);
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1;
server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) {
server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0;
}
} else {
sendMessage(“Not enough space in your inventory.”);
break;
}
} else {
sendMessage(“You don’t have enough Tokkul.”);
}
}

}
Good job, Your almost done! Save this, and open up Shop.cfg
You don’t change anything in Shop.cfg, but i am just giving you an example of a shop
shop = 1 TzHaar-Hur-Tel’s Equipment Store 1 1 6522 1000 6523 10 6524 10 6525 10 6526 10 6527 10 6528 10 6568 5
This would be a shop you might use for tokkul. It is the Obsidian shop so it would make sense to use something like this.
Please note, you might want to change the 1 1 to whatever it is in your sever that makes it so you CANNOT sell items, or you can only sell the shop items. The reason is because you can sell any item to this shop for the normal price but in tokkul.
Example: whips in your server are 2m cash to the store. You could sell a whip for 2m Tokkul to this store.
Just a reminder

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Help?
item.dc:creator: @WestSideMass WestSideMass
item.description:
@WestSideMass wrote:

I need more help with a few things…

I have a Pest Control Mini-Game on my 317, for the rewards, I tested them all out (they are all 100 points each) but they don’t take 100 points. How do I modify how much it takes for the rewards?

Another thing, how do I add items to my Assault Mini-Game shop? I’ve looked it up in Client.Java, but can’t find anything about it. I can actually add the items, but I don’t know how to make it take Assault Points instead of money.

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
